moves.1. g3: I wanted to play something different from my routine
moves.3... h6 4. O-O Qc7 5. d4: Its a good policy to place a P on a central sq
moves.6. Bf4 Bd6 7. Bxd6 Qxd6: Dark sq Bs are gone. Important factor in this game.
moves.8. Nbd2 Nf6 9. c4: Gain of room on Q side
moves.10. Re1: Center file is closed but the R is well placed here
moves.11... dxe4 12. Nxe4 Nxe4 13. Rxe4 Nf6 14: Another choice is the e3 sq, so later the rook can move to a3 or b3 to attack Q side.
moves.16... Nf6 17. c5: Blocking c6 and plan is to plant the N on d6
moves.17... Rd8 18. Rd1 Nd5: No worries about this knight as I can trade it for the bishop when needed
moves.19... Qc7 20. h4: No hurry in playing BxN coz it will open diagonal for the B
moves.20... Bd7 21. h5: This move puts pressure on the K side
moves.21... Be8 22. Nc4 Nf6 23. Nd6: d6, weak sq for blk strong sq for w
moves.24... b5: Blk has good hold on the white squares but he didn't payed much attention to the blk sqs
moves.25... Rxd6: Blk gives up R for the strong N and a P
moves.28... Rb6 29. Rdc1: More pressure on the base pawn
moves.30. Bxd5: I think this was the right time to exchange the central N
moves.34... a5 35. Rc7 a4: 5 of the 7 Ps are on light squares
moves.40... Bd7 41. f3 Kf6 42. Kf2: I need the K for attack
moves.44... Kf7 45. f5: Taking away 1 more sq from the B
moves.48... Ke8 49. Kd6:
Once again occupying the d6 sq.
Soon the B will be captured.
Blk Resigned.
